definition[0]: an organization that is part of the UN (United Nations), which lends money to poorer countries so that they can develop their farming, industry, and health and education systems. Its two main parts are the IBRD (International Bank for Reconstruction and Development) and the IDA (International Development Association).
definition[1]: a group of five organizations based in Washington D.C. and linked to the United Nations that gives financial help and advice to developing countries
example[0]: The dams, funded by the World Bank, were among many ambitious projects to open up the Amazon.
